titleInfo.title: View No. 15. Chickamauga. Thirteenth and Twentieth Louisiana Regiment and Adams' Louisiana Brigade.

subject.topic: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)

mods.abstract: This view shows the most advanced position reached by this regiment and Adams' Louisiana Brigade, of which it was the extreme right, in the charge made by this brigade into the woods south of the fields, west of the road, on the McDonald farm. The stake with white cloth marks the point where stood the right of this regiment, before it was driven back. It stands some 400 yards west of the main Chattanooga road and about 800 yards from the fields from which the Brigade started in the charge.This position was fixed September 24th, 1894, by the Louisiana and the National Commissioners and marked by E. E. Betts, engineer of the National Commission, in whose field notes it appear as right of 13th and 20th Louisiana line-38-W.97'-17x92.

titleInfo.title: Chickamauga-Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.) Louisiana Committee. Photographs
Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park Photographs

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
